body: That would artificially inflate the member count of those groups, not to mention that's very subjective. I honestly have no interest in the first 3, and it would be annoying having those be automatically subscribed to me
body_html: That would artificially inflate the member count of those groups, not to mention that's very subjective. I honestly have no interest in the first 3, and it would be annoying having those be automatically subscribed to me

body:
While I agree the non-logged in user landing page needs to be better (with Kek's changes it's already way better than it was). I don't think Limiting it to only a few subs that are "approved" is the way to go it.

I know there are other methods being discussed, maybe someone that has more knowledge of them could explain the concepts behind them.


While I don't agree with your opinion, you shouldn't be punished for it. I have upvoted to foster debate.
body_html:
While I agree the non-logged in user landing page needs to be better (with Kek's changes it's already way better than it was). I don't think Limiting it to only a few subs that are "approved" is the way to go it.

I know there are other methods being discussed, maybe someone that has more knowledge of them could explain the concepts behind them.

While I don't agree with your opinion, you shouldn't be punished for it. I have upvoted to foster debate.

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
No, that's a very bad idea. It could cause a powermod cabal to form because the admins would promoting certain guilds ahead of others. Reddit did that, and it's the reason why the "go make your own sub if you don't like ours" excuse doesn't work, because normal users can't actually grow a subreddit, only mods of the default subs. It's kind of like crony capitalism.

I'd rather see the ability to block guilds you don't like.
body_html:
No, that's a very bad idea. It could cause a powermod cabal to form because the admins would promoting certain guilds ahead of others. Reddit did that, and it's the reason why the "go make your own sub if you don't like ours" excuse doesn't work, because normal users can't actually grow a subreddit, only mods of the default subs. It's kind of like crony capitalism.

I'd rather see the ability to block guilds you don't like.

body: Default subs are a large part of why reddit has become such an echo chamber.
body_html: Default subs are a large part of why reddit has become such an echo chamber.
